bugprone-assert-side-effect.description:
Description

Finds
assert()
with side effect.

The condition of
assert()
is evaluated only in debug builds so a
condition with side effect can cause different behavior in debug / release
builds.
bugprone-assert-side-effect.option:
Static analysis (Clang-Tidy) options are configured via .clang-tidy file.

Options
AssertMacros
A comma-separated list of the names of assert macros to be checked.
Default is
assert,NSAssert,NSCAssert
.
CheckFunctionCalls
Whether to treat non-const member and non-member functions as they produce
side effects. Disabled by default because it can increase the number of false
positive warnings.
IgnoredFunctions
A semicolon-separated list of the names of functions or methods to be
considered as not having side-effects. Regular expressions are accepted,
e.g.
[Rr]ef(erence)?$
matches every type with suffix
Ref
,
ref
,
Reference
and
reference
. The default is empty. If a name in the list
contains the sequence
::
it is matched against the qualified type name
(i.e.
namespace::Type
), otherwise it is matched against only
the type name (i.e.
Type
).
